definitions.definition: empty, with nothing written, printed or recorded on it

examples.text: Sign your name in the blank space below.
Write on one side of the paper and leave the other side blank.
She turned to a blank page in her notebook.
I left the third column blank.

definitions.definition: empty; with no pictures, marks or decoration
showing no feeling, understanding or interest

examples.text: She stared at me with a blank expression on her face.
Steve **looked blank** and said he had no idea what I was talking about.
Suddenly **my mind went blank** *(= I could not remember anything)*.
I asked several people about it and just got **blank stares** in return.
Her explanation was met with blank looks.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that has the potential to be developed or changed in many different ways

examples.text: The building is a blank canvas for a clever investor to potentially make a lot of money.
Alice was a blank slate in the first film because she had memory loss and knew nothing about herself.

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘white, colourless’): from Old French blanc ‘white’, ultimately of Germanic origin.
